Articles.Content:
<figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="http://41.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_nuomjsLCvK1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><figure data-orig-width="1366" data-orig-height="768" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="1366" data-orig-height="768" src="http://41.media.tumblr.com/c8e6e5fd0e128c6aa0d37e440a55b6da/tumblr_inline_nuomkwUOu51rr2wit_540.png"/></figure><p>

Kartographer is a utility mod that adds new menus to the map view. Through these new menus you can do such things as edit, delete and restore manoeuvres, select the focus point of the camera and warp set amounts of time along your orbit. <br/></p>If this sounds useful to you then you can find the mod and the download links in <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/134137"><b>this forum thread</b></a>.
First!!! I saw that mod on Kerbal Stuff. Looks cool. It'll likely break in 1.1 considering the huge amount of map updating you guys are doing...
Looks cool! Might have to give it a try in my career save, sounds like it makes precision a lot more possible.

I am afraid if I install this mod as well, I could not see a thing under the all hubs I already have

Not saying that this this bad mode, though. It definitely worth a try.

Edited September 16, 2015 by Mad_Scientist
